intro: Meineckia phyllanthoides subsp. phyllanthoides, commonly known as the African flame tree, is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family. It is a deciduous shrub or small tree native to southern Africa. The plant features compound leaves with small, clustered leaflets and produces striking red or orange flowers. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release seeds. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in various soil conditions.
